=== From: Natalie de Maar <natalie@demaarlaw.com>
Sent: Tuesday, May 14, 2024 3:26 PM

=== To: Lisa Ann Sharpe <sharpe@lasher.com>; Lisa Summers <summers@lasher.com>

=== Cc: April Collins <april@demaarlaw.com>; Legal Assistant <legalassistant@demaarlaw.com>

=== Subject: Moyer - Can we agree on a temporary parenting plan
Dear Lisa
I think both parties and the boys should have a preliminary session before we start talking about changing the temporary plan we have in place. I did
hear that Robert wanted this weekend again with Adrian, and I agreed to another weekend visit this weekend.
I understand at the last visitation they played ping pong and they had lunch. I would like your client to consider a more constructive activity with
Adrian that would be a little more meaningful towards building a relationship. I think they might spend some time brainstorming with the supervisor
ideas and then there could be enthusiasm built around doing more fun activities.
You may know I have 6 boys (now adults) and 11 grandchildren, and they always wanted to do something and with nice weather that could be a
sports game, an exhibition, a fair, go on a hike, etc and on rain days a science museum, a home depot project event, Dave and Busters- you get the idea.
There is so much to do around here I urge your client to build fun time and activities with Adrian as well as just doing lunch and a game of ping pong.
Natalie de Maar
Attorney at Law
Sent:08/14/2024 at 11:48 PM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 08/15/2024 at 05:29 AM)
Subject:An Oldie but a Goodie
